back_cards.example_en: His shoes were dirty after hiking in the mud.
The politician used dirty tactics to win.
The comedian’s dirty jokes offended some.
The kitchen was dirty after cooking dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: Dull or cloudy, as in weather.
back_cards.example_en: The sky looked dirty before the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: An object for play or amusement.
back_cards.example_en: The child clutched his favorite toy.
The store sold fun toy robots.
The drone was a toy for hobbyists.

back_cards.definition_en: A thing of little value or importance.
back_cards.example_en: The trinket was just a toy to her.
The toy car looked like the real thing.
This could potentially solve our problem.
She’s potentially a great leader.
The storm could potentially cause delays.
The plan is potentially dangerous.
The idea is potentially profitable.
The assault left him with minor injuries.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong verbal attack or criticism.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was an assault on corruption.
The army planned an assault at dawn.

back_cards.definition_en: An attempt to harm or intimidate.
back_cards.example_en: The assault on her reputation was unfair.
The assault of noise overwhelmed the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: The highest point of a mountain.
back_cards.example_en: They climbed to the peak of the mountain.
Her career reached its peak last year.
The storm hit its peak at midnight.
The roof’s peak was covered in snow.

back_cards.definition_en: A high point in activity or success.
back_cards.example_en: Sales reached a peak during the holidays.
His anger flared after the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction to injustice or frustration.
back_cards.example_en: She felt anger at the unfair decision.
Their anger led to a heated debate.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of being upset or irritated.
back_cards.example_en: His anger was evident in his tone.
The insult sparked anger in the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: A sturdy shoe covering the ankle.
back_cards.example_en: She wore boots to hike in the rain.
He gave the ball a strong boot.

back_cards.definition_en: A protective cover, as for a car.
back_cards.example_en: The spare tire was stored in the boot.
He got the boot from his job.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of equipment for protection.
back_cards.example_en: The ski boots kept her feet warm.
The movie had a dramatic ending.
She took a dramatic role in the play.
The storm caused a dramatic change in plans.
His dramatic speech moved the audience.
The sunset painted a dramatic sky.

back_cards.definition_en: A person of the same age or status.
back_cards.example_en: She discussed the project with her peers.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a group with equal standing.
back_cards.example_en: His peers respected his leadership.

back_cards.definition_en: A colleague in a professional setting.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist shared findings with her peers.

back_cards.definition_en: A noble in a ranked system.
back_cards.example_en: The peer was invited to the ceremony.

back_cards.definition_en: A friend or equal in a social circle.
back_cards.example_en: He felt pressure from his peers to join.
She used spices to enhance the flavor.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase the value or quality.
back_cards.example_en: The software update enhanced performance.
Training enhanced his skills significantly.

back_cards.definition_en: To make more appealing or effective.
back_cards.example_en: The design enhanced the room’s beauty.

back_cards.definition_en: To augment or refine a feature.
back_cards.example_en: They enhanced the app with new tools.

back_cards.definition_en: The study of numbers and shapes.
back_cards.example_en: She excelled in math at school.
Math was his favorite class.
The project required complex math.
Math helped her analyze the data.
The math behind the game was fascinating.
